sentences.en: Enjoin the Defendant permanently from violating its own organization bylaws.
sentences.cn: 责成被告永不违反其组织章程.
伊斯兰教告诫人们要宽容。

sentences.en: Orders to intelligence operatives often enjoin secrecy.
sentences.cn: 对情报间谍的命令常需要保密.

sentences.en: Others, I joined a personal party, met some new friends, enjoin that too.
sentences.cn: 别的事情, 我参加了个私人的聚会, 认识了一些新的朋友, 很开心.

sentences.en: Out of such initiatives, they will learn that all religions enjoin goodness.
sentences.cn: 通过积极的方式互相认识, 大家最终会明白所有宗教的目的都是宣扬真、善、美.

sentences.en: Religion and morality enjoin this conduct.
sentences.cn: 宗教和道德要求这种行为.

sentences.en: She enjoined me strictly not to tell anyone else.
sentences.cn: 她严令我不要告诉其他任何人。

sentences.en: She put a finger to her lips to enjoin silence.
sentences.cn: 她放一根手指在她的唇上以交待安静.

sentences.en: When the patient works, enjoin notices to protect, wear defend the shoe.
sentences.cn: 嘱病人劳动时注重保护, 穿防护鞋等.

trans.tran_cn: 吩咐, 命令, 嘱咐, <主美>禁止
trans.tran_en: If you enjoin someone to do something, you order them to do it. If you enjoin an action or attitude, you order people to do it or have it.
